How do I install the Verus CLI (command line interface) wallet on a brand new Linux system?

To install the Verus CLI wallet on a brand new Linux system, follow these steps:

**Step 1: Update the System**
First, make sure your Linux system is up to date by running the following commands:
```
sudo apt-get update && apt-get upgrade -y
```
**Step 2: Create a New User (Optional)**
It's recommended to create a new user instead of using the root account. To do this, run the following commands:
```
sudo adduser newusername
sudo usermod -aG sudo newusername
```
Then, switch to the new user by running:
```
su - newusername
```
**Step 3: Verify Sudo Access**
Test that the new user has sudo access by running:
```
sudo ls -la /root
```
This should display some lines indicating that the user has access to the root directory.

**Step 4: Download and Install Wallet Binaries**
Download the Verus CLI wallet binaries from the official website and extract them using the following commands:
```
wget https://github.com/VerusCoin/VerusCoin/releases/download/v0.9.3/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.9.3-amd64.tgz
tar -xvf Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.9.3-amd64.tgz
tar -xvf Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.9.3-amd64.tar.gz
cd verus-cli
```
**Step 5: Fetch Parameters**
Run the following command to fetch parameters, which may take some time depending on your internet connection:
```
./fetch-params
```
**Step 6: Create Chaindata Directory**
Create the chaindata directory by running:
```
cd ~
mkdir -p.komodo/VRSC
cd ~/.komodo/VRSC
```
**Step 7: Download Block-Chain Bootstrap (Optional)**
Download the block-chain bootstrap to speed up synchronization of the block-chain from days to minutes:
```
wget https://bootstrap.verus.io/VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz
tar -xvf VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz
```
**Step 8: Install Libraries**
Finally, install the required libraries for Verus by running:
```
sudo apt-get install libcurl3
```
That's it! You should now have the Verus CLI wallet installed on your Linux system.
